Name: White Peony
Description: Toasty, nutty, a white-tea that somewhat tastes a bit closer to green tea than white, but less bitter. The pure taste of it is an ideal balance between bitter and sweet

Name: Iron Goddess of Mercy
Description: Minimalistic, uniform, refreshing, brief tangy sweetness, if someone used magic to remove everything bad with mint, and only left the good parts

Name: Blueberry Rooibos
Description: Sweet, mild, earthy, good amount of sharpness

Name: Dragon Well
Description: Nutty, toasted green tea flavor, proeminent, a bit bitter, but less bitter than most green teas, a bit of an aftertaste

Name: Silver Needles
Description: Mild, Refreshing

Name: Greek Mountain Malotiras
Description: Simple, refreshing, mildly earthy

Name: Breakfast
Description: One of the best black teas I had, for some reason it really does not have a bitterness that is expected with black tea. Combines well with oatmilk.

Name: Tangerine Ginger
Description: Fruity, sweet

Name: Peach Blossom
Description: Peach with white tea notes; refreshing, fruitym energizing

Name: Scarlet
Description: Sweet

Name: Orange Blossom
Description: Citrus, Fruity, slightly: sour, acidic, and sweet; refreshing, slight aftertaste

Name: Garden Party
Description: Strawberry-ish, sweet, slight citrus

Name: Hibiscus Berry
Description: Very similar to blueberry rooibos but with a bit less taste

Name: Golden Yunnan
Description: Refreshing, good, not as bitter as expected. I am just not that big of a fan of a black tea overall, this is one of the best I've had.

Name: Chamomile Medley
Description: mild, simple

Name: Jasmine Pearls
Description: Similar to Jasmine Moonlight, a bit better

Name: Schisandra Berry Blush
Description: Tangy, Fruity, floral, great aroma, tiny bitter aftertaste

Name: Jade Cloud
Description: Smells good, tastes like a strong green tea, and just as bitter as a strong green tea.

Name: Moonlight Jasmine
Description: Bitter, strong, energizing

Name: Rooibos
Description: Earthy, not as extreme as butterfly pea flower

Name: Ginseng Detox
Description: Punchy, artichoke-like

Name: Lavender Mint
Description: Just mint

Name: Pu'erh Tuo Cha
Description: tastes like Black tea on steroids. Has a 'musty'—almost moldy—taste to it. Does not combine well with honey or sugar. Milk makes it tastier, almost nutty; but with a weird aftertaste.

Name: Organic Darjeeling Green Tea
Description: had worse green teas and had better ones. Costco one is better. It has a bit of a unique taste to it, but not my cup of tea. However, it's extremely cheap, and not disgusting. I recommend it if saving money is essential.

Name: Thé Vert Sencha
Description: Awful. Has a strong after taste.

Name: Mystic Mint
Description: Too powerful and bitter, would be better if it tasted milder, potential with sugar

Name: Butterfly Pea Flower
Description: Tastes like what I imagine ground soy/edamame pressed and milked would taste like. It is super earthy. Not good. Has a beautiful vibrant blue color though

Name: Blueberry Hibiscus
Description: A bit sour and musty, citrusy, sharp, vegetable/earthy taste like a stale asparagus/artichoke. Blueberry is barely noticeable. It's more like Rooibos, but if you left it to age for a while

Name: Chocolate Mint
Description: You know the smell of play-doh? It tastes like that. Artificial like taste, and, personally, has an artificial feeling of swetness to it. Disgusting

Name: Pumpkin spice
Description: Same problem as other Harney & Sons teas: taste of play-doh. Just plain artificial like taste, dirty, overwhelming cinnamon. Blows my mind there are people who enjoy this. Dirty old rag water would taste better.
